param_check_for_duplicates.description: If set, the fylr database is queried for duplicates of the file. The `_duplicate` property will be added to the response.
param_check_for_duplicates.name: check_for_duplicates

param_collection.description: Collection is the id of a collection the uploaded files should be linked into. This works like the hotfolder upload into a collection. The collection needs to be configured as upload collection. The `_linked_objects` property will be set in the response with informations about the created or updated objects the files have been linked to.
param_collection.name: collection

param_custom_produce_configs.description: Array of custom produce config definitions as used in `POST /api/v1/eas/{fileId}`.
param_custom_produce_configs.name: custom_produce_configs

param_format.description: The format of the output. `standard` is the default and includes the `versions` property. `long` includes `metadata` and `versions`. `short` doesn't include neither. If an unknown format is given `short` is used.
param_format.name: format

param_header_x-fylr-signature.description: The signature to omit file permission checks. It will be added to the URL when retrieved through `/api/db`, `/api/search` or other endpoints which deliver fylr URLs. The signature will be taken from the query parameter first and if not found, from the request header.
param_header_x-fylr-signature.name: x-fylr-signature

param_id_parents.description: Array of integer with a list of parent ids. A parent id must be set for manual rendition uploads when using `version_names`. The id must point to a file "original".
param_id_parents.name: id_parents

param_mapping.description: If `mapping` is given, the file's metadata is used to compile a `_mapped_metadata` object in the response. `mapping` can either be the `_id` of the mapping or the keyword `standard`. The `standard` mapping will use the object type (and pool i.A.) to determine the standard mapping.
param_mapping.name: mapping

param_mask.description: The `mask` the mapping is compiled for.
param_mask.name: mask

param_objecttype.description: The object type for which the mapping is compiled.
param_objecttype.name: objecttype

param_path_format.description: The [IIIF size](https://iiif.io/api/image/2.0/#size) parameter determines the dimensions to which the extracted region is to be scaled. Check the link for more information. Formats `jpg` and `png` are delivered with fast code if the quality is set to `color` or `default` and no `rotation` is requested.
param_path_format.name: format

param_path_obj_uuid.description: The `_uuid` of the object the file is linked into. This is used for the permission check.
param_path_obj_uuid.name: obj_uuid

param_path_quality.description: The [IIIF format](https://iiif.io/api/image/2.0/#quality) parameter determines whether the image is delivered in color, grayscale or black and white. Click on the link for more information.
param_path_quality.name: quality

param_path_region.description: The [IIIF region](https://iiif.io/api/image/2.0/#region) is a string with `x,y,w,h` and other format. Check the link for more information.
param_path_region.name: region

param_path_rotation.description: The [IIIF rotation](https://iiif.io/api/image/2.0/#rotation) specifies mirroring and rotation. A leading exclamation mark (“!”) indicates that the image should be mirrored by reflection on the vertical axis before any rotation is applied. The numerical value represents the number of degrees of clockwise rotation, and may be any number from 0 to 360. **fylr** only supports integer numbers for rotation. More information can be found in the link.
param_path_rotation.name: rotation

param_path_size.description: The [IIIF size](https://iiif.io/api/image/2.0/#size) parameter determines the dimensions to which the extracted region is to be scaled. Check the link for more information.
param_path_size.name: size

param_path_x-fylr-signature.description: The signature to omit file permission checks. It will be added to the URL when retrieved through `/api/db`, `/api/search` or other endpoints which deliver fylr URLs.
param_path_x-fylr-signature.name: x-fylr-signature

param_path_zippath.description:
For `zip` files, you can add the path into a zip to extract a specific file
from the ZIP.
param_path_zippath.name: zippath

param_pool_id.description: The `pool_id` sets the pool id to determine the mapping if `standard` is requested.
param_pool_id.name: pool_id

param_priority.description: When adding the renditions job to the file worker queue a priority is used. Set `2` for interactive, `4` for highest and `0` for normal.
param_priority.name: priority

param_produce_versions.description: Array of boolean with a list of values corresponding to each file. If set to `true`, fylr produces renditions for each file uploaded, if set to `false`, no versions are produced. If no values is given (no parameter set or less values than needed), `true` is assumed.
param_produce_versions.name: produce_versions

param_query_obj_uuid.description: The `_uuid` of the object the file is linked into. This is used for the permission check.
param_query_obj_uuid.name: obj_uuid

param_query_x-fylr-signature.description: The signature to omit file permission checks. It will be added to the URL when retrieved through `/api/db`, `/api/search` or other endpoints which deliver fylr URLs. The signature will be taken from the query parameter first and if not found, from the request header.
param_query_x-fylr-signature.name: x-fylr-signature

param_references.description: Array of string with a list of references corresponding to each file. File references are unique across all files.
param_references.name: references

param_skip_duplicate_reference.description:
If set, this setting avoids unique constraints error from duplicate reference. Instead, if a duplicate is encountered the response loads the exsting file and
marks it notes that in `_duplicates`.

If `/rput/bulk` is used and the request contains a new file and duplicates of it, all files will be carray the `_duplicates` marker in the response.
param_skip_duplicate_reference.name: skip_duplicate_reference

param_version_names.description: Array of string with a list of version names corresponding to each file. If a version name is given, the upload is meant to be a manual rendition. As such, the `id_parents` must be given alongside with it. The referenced parent files must be `original` and have set their `produce_versions` to false. Version names must be unique for all manually uploaded versions.
param_version_names.name: version_names

param_zoom_format.description:
The output format of a tile. The internal compute chain works with a `BMP` without alpha channel. So, the zoomer
will not support transparency for `PNG`, but use a white background instead.
param_zoom_format.name: format

param_zoom_tile_size.description: The tile size for the zoom responses in pixels. Default is `320`.
param_zoom_tile_size.name: zoom_tile_size

param_zoom_viewport.description: The viewport is the width of the desired rectangle for the tile selection. The minimum is 100. If the original image width is 4000px and the viewport is 40000px, the zoom factor will be 10. The image is zoomed so that the width of the resulting image is as large as this parameter.
param_zoom_viewport.name: zoom_viewport

param_zoom_x.description:
Within the viewport zoomed image `zoom_x` is the tile number on the x-axis on
a tought grid. The tile size is 320 unless given otherwise. If an image is
3200px (width) x 16000px (height) and the viewport is 32000px, we have a zoom
factor of 10. With a tile size of 320, this results in a grid of 100 x 50
tiles.
param_zoom_x.name: zoom_x

param_zoom_y.description:
Within the viewport zoomed image `zoom_y` is the tile number on the y-axis on
a tought grid. The tile size is 320 unless given otherwise. If an image is
3200px (width) x 16000px (height) and the viewport is 32000px, we have a zoom
factor of 10. With a tile size of 320, this results in a grid of 100 x 50
tiles.
param_zoom_y.name: zoom_y

file.description:
The file to upload. The `filename` parameter from the `Content-Disposition` header will be used as the file name. Only the base part of the filename is used. The parsing of the path is platform-dependent.
The user needs the right to upload a file into the specific class in any of the rights configuration.

additionalProperties.description: _key_ is the name of the plugin

name.description: name of the parameter as used in the API

position.description: Position of the parameter in the output.

ConfigParamEmail.description: **email** is an email address consisting of loca part and domain name.

_id.description: An eas file id from fylr.

ConfigParamFile.description: **file** is an eas file managed by fylr.

ConfigParamForm.description: **form** is one row of nested parameters.

plugin_type.description: For some JSON, we support predefined schema.

ConfigParamJson.description: The value of this type is and abritrary JSON object.

default.description: Location is a name of a configured location

ConfigParamLocationSelect.description: This presents a location select to the user.

ConfigParamSecret.description: **secret** is string which will be stored encrypted in the database, if `fylr.encryptionKey` is set.

options.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamSelect.description: **select** is a choice select for one out of a list of options

choices.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamStringList.description: **string-list** is a list of choices presented to the user.

choices.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamStringListSort.description: **string-list-sort** is a list of sortable choices presented to the user.

fields.description: Items of this array are of schema ConfigParam

default.description: Tagfilter is a map of sets of ids, as used in the fylr API.

ConfigParamTagfilterSelect.description: This presents a tagfilter select to the user.

ConfigParamTextLocaMultiline.description: **text-l10n-multinline** is like `text-l10n` but displayed in multiline form.

ConfigParamTextMultiline.description: **text-multiline** is like `text` but displayed in a mutliline form.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this license was created.

domains.description: Must match fylr.externalURL, allows simple wildcard "*".

edition.description: Edition of the license, such as "workgroup", "department", or "organization".

holder.description: Name of the holder of the license.

issuer.description: Name of the issuer of the license.

key.description: UUID of license file, e.g., for blacklisting.

type.description: Type of license, such as "subscription" or "buy".

from.description: Valid from this date, if empty already valid.

to.description: Valid to this date, if empty license does not expire.

enabled.description: Set to **true** if this tag is available?

is_default.description:
Set to **true** if the tag is set by default when creating new objects.
This is a frontend only flag.

sticky.description: If set this tag cannot be removed by Pools which maintain their own tag lists.

type.description:
A tag group of type **checkbox** can set multiple tags of that group. A tag group
of type **choice** can only set one tag of that group.

items.description: Each item describes a config setting.

group.description: The **group** sets the tab this config variable is in.

name.description: The unique name of this config

require_system_right.description: System right which this config requires, e.g. "system.root" if it requires root rights.

unauthenticated_visible.description: If true, this config is visible to unauthenticated sessions (access token with no user).

additionalProperties.description: _key_ is the name of the plugin

_duplicates.description: If set, this attribute can hold an array of duplicates.

certainty.description: The certainty of the duplicate detection in percent. A value of 1.0 means 100%. Currently **fylr** can only detect exact same files (as per file hash).

_column_id.description: The column API id of the column holding the duplicate file.

_system_object_id.description: The `_system_object_id` of the object using the duplicate file.

_id.description: The `_id` is **created** _when_ a file is uploaded into the fylr server.

_linked_objects.description: When a file is uploaded and linked to a collection via [`/api/eas`](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/api/endpoints/api-eas), the attribute contains a list of objects created based on the upload settings of that collection.

_version.description: The `_version` of the object created or updated. An upload may update an existing object if a version or series detection added a file to an existing nested or an existing file array.

_mapped_metadata.description: A rendered version of the object data retrived and mapped from this file's metadata. It can be used to create objects based on a pre-configured metadata mapping.

best_date.description: Best date is a compiled UTC timestamp from the technical metadata. **fylr** uses the first set date from `technical_metadata.date_time_original`, `technical_metadata.create_date`, `date_uploaded`.

class.description: The compiled class of the file. The classes are set by the recipe. Standard recipes of fylr include `image`, `audio`, `office`, `video`. The fylr frontend uses the class to pick the general player to view the file. A class `unknown` is assigned if no matching recipe was found but the upload accepts _unknown types_.

class_extension.description: A compiled concatenation of `class`, `version`, joined by `.`. This is used for aggregations of files

class_version_status.description: A compiled concatenation of `class`, `version` and `status`, joined by `.`. This is used for aggregations of file status.

compiled.description: A compiled version of the metadata for this file. For images this looks like this: `	JPG, 1920 x 1285 px, 569.5 kB`.

compiled_props.description: A fielded version of `compiled`. Frontends can use this to beatify the compiled output of the metadata.

dimensions.description: The rendered dimensions for this file. This may include a unit. For page sizes European paper sizes like A4 will be recognised.

duration.description: Runtime of the audio or video file.

extension.description: The upper cased version of the `extension`.

pages.description: The number of pages followed by a ` p.`. Frontends may localize this manually.

date_uploaded.description: The UTC timestamp when this file was uploaded.

eas_parent_id.description: The `eas_parent_id` is the id of the file this file is derived from. When using **/api/produce**, the newly produced files will get the parent id set to the file they are produced from.

extension.description: The compiled extension of the file. This is matched by parsing available recipes at the time of the metadata generation. Extensions are matched by longer length first. So for a file `flower.webdvd.zip` the extension matched would be `.webdvd.zip` and not `.zip` if there is an available recipe.

frontend_prefs.description: Set only in relation to an object. This map can contain custom attributes and values.

hash.description: The `hash` is a non unique identifier of the file. For remote files, it is the [**md5sum**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum) of the URL, for local files it is the [**SHA-256**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2) of the binary file data. It is calculated together with the metadata for the file and a copy of `technical_metadata.sha256_hash`. The `hash` is used for duplicate detection.

is_original.description: Set to true if the file is an original. It is false if the file is a generated or uploaded rendition. Produced files are registered as originals underneath the original they are produced from.

last_status_at.description: The UTC timestamp when the last status change was last written to the database.

reference.description: The `reference` of the file to look up.

groupnames.description: Sorted list of metadata group names found in `groups`.

group.description: The group name of the attribute

value.description: The value can be any type

name.description: Custom name of the file. This is set in the relation to the object. When retrieving the file via [`/api/eas`](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/api/endpoints/api-eas).

original_filename.description: The filename as set by `original_filepath` minus the path.

original_filename_basename.description: The filename as set by `original_filepath` minus the path and the detected `extension`.

original_filepath.description: Filename of the file as set during the upload. On Windows, this can contain drive letters and backslashes.

preferred.description: This may be set if the file is in the context of an object. If set, preferred indicates that this version is the preferred one in a list of other versions.

reference.description: If set, this reference string is a unique string identifying the file. If the reference contains a `sha244:<hash>` or `sha256:<hash>`, the provided hash can be checked against the file's checksum using an action triggerable in **/inspect/files**. Other parts of the reference can be added but must be separated by `:`.

status.description: The status of the file. Known states are: `pending`, `processing`, `sync`, `done`, `failed`. Files and renditions can be accessed in status `sync` and `done`. Only files in state `done` can be exported.

technical_metadata.description: An object to describe technical aspects of the file. See [Technical Metadata](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file#technical_metadata) for details.

upload_user.description: The user who uploaded this file into the system. If the upload happens via Hotfolder, the uploader is the owner of the upload collection.

user.description: This will show a short representation of [user](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/user).

additionalProperties.description: The file version specification can be found [here](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file#file_version).

versions.description: `versions` contains a map with renditions for the file. Depending on the users permissions, not all versions might be accessible.

frontend_prefs.description:
Frontend preferences can be any JSON Map with data used by applications. The
conventions here is that each application can use its on key on the top level
of this Map. Only this key may be modified by the application, foreign keys
must be kept unchanged.

id.description:
The **_id** is a used to uniquely identify an object. It is automatically
assigned by the server for new objects.

It is possible to manually set the **_id**, the internal sequence will be
adopted accordingly.

lang.description: Texts used to for language aware contexts.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this license was created.

domains.description: Must match fylr.externalURL, allows simple wildcard "*".

edition.description: Edition of the license, such as "workgroup", "department", or "organization".

holder.description: Name of the holder of the license.

issuer.description: Name of the issuer of the license.

key.description: UUID of license file, e.g., for blacklisting.

type.description: Type of license, such as "subscription" or "buy".

from.description: Valid from this date, if empty already valid.

to.description: Valid to this date, if empty license does not expire.

match.description: If the version matches, the custom parameters overwrite the recipe's parameters. It is mandatory to have at least one parameter set, otherwise this overwrite will be ignored.

schedule.description: A schedule sets criterias to repeatedly start task or jobs. All defined criterias need to be met in order for a schedule to run.

items.description: The day of the month when this schedule should run.
The hour when this schedule should run. Range `0`-`23`.
The minute when this schedule should run. Range `0`-`59`.

timezone.description: The timezone this schedule should be run in. Valid names are in [IANA format](https://www.iana.org/time-zones).

weekdays.description: The weekday when this schedule should run.

enabled.description: Set to **true** if this tag is available?

is_default.description:
Set to **true** if the tag is set by default when creating new objects.
This is a frontend only flag.

sticky.description: If set this tag cannot be removed by Pools which maintain their own tag lists.

type.description:
A tag group of type **checkbox** can set multiple tags of that group. A tag group
of type **choice** can only set one tag of that group.

_id.description: ID of the task. This is issued by the server.

created_at.description: UTC time of when the task was created.

description.description: A user provided description of the task.

email.description: The email address of the recipient. Mails are send using the `To:` email header.

problems_only.description: If set, emails are only sent if the task finished with a state other than `done`.

frontend_prefs.description: Provided by API using Apps. The top level key of the map should reflect the name of your App. Apps are required to store unknown keys (and data) along with their own contribution.

next_run_at.description: The UTC time when the task will be started. It is possible that the task is run later that the given time (if other tasks are currently running), but not before. Set this to `null` to not execute this task. If a task is scheduled, the scheduler will update this property after the task has run.

run_canceled_at.description: UTC time when the last run of the task was canceled. It is set to `null` when the task re-starts.

run_finished_at.description: UTC time when the last run of the task has finished. It is set to `null` when the task re-starts.

run_started_at.description: UTC time when the last run of the task was started. It is set to `null` when the task re-starts.

state.description: Stores the state of a task. This can be used by the task module to continue interrupted work or otherwise. The data is provided over the API, so frontends may use it.

status.description: `status` is set by the **fylr** task runner.

status_msg.description: If the status is `error` or `canceled`, the status message gives more information.

status_percent.description: If supported by the task runner, a number in percent indicating the progress of a task in state `running`. This can be `null` if the task module has not started updating this yet, or it is not supported by the task module. Frontends should only show and use this if it is not `null`.

task_module.description: Name of the task module to run the task. Retrieve a list with `/api/v1/task/module`.

task_params.description: The task properties. The schema for this is defined by the task module.

task_timeout_sec.description: When the task is run, this timeout is set. In case of a timeout the task will be in state `error`. Use `0` for no timeout.

updated_at.description: UTC time of when the task was updated.

version.description:
Version of the task. The version must be incremented when saving a new
version of the task. While the task is running, the server may perform
updates on the task object without incrementing the version.

format.description: The format of the file: `landscape`, `portrait` or `square`.

_generated_displayname.description: The generated displayname of the user. This uses `login` and `email`.

_id.description: The id of the user. It is automatically assigned.

version.description:
The **_version** needs to be set to **1** for new objects and set to an
incremented number on each object update. This is used to ensure that two
clients do not overwrite data of the same object.

info.description: This API documentation is work in progress and not yet complete.
info.title: FYLR API

/config.description:
Administrators can define base configuration using this API. fylr has a basic
set of configuration items which are in the core system, such as the name of
the instance, administrator's main address, language definitions and so on.

Frontends are required to implement a generic form editor for base
configuration items. The list of items can be retrieved using the
[config/list](list/) API.

This list is not stable and can be changed without API change in any new
version of fylr. Plugins can extend the list of configuration items. So,
depending on the list of loaded plugins in fylr, the list has a various number
of items.

apikey.description: The string will be encrypted in the server if fylr.encryptionKey is set in fylr.yml. In API responses, if a value is set, the response will always be *** or ***** to indicate that an encrypted value is stored. ***** mean that the value is actually stored encrypted, whereas *** means the value is stored as plain text.

200.description: The response contains the base configuration values.

get.description:
The list is a dynamic compilation of available config varibles. It includes
fixed config variables of FYLR's base config as well as variables provided
by plugins.

200.description: Success

parameters.description: A json formatted array of file IDs. Example: `[1,3,4]`.
parameters.name: ids

additionalProperties.description: The [file](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file) rendering. The `key` is the file ID.

200.description: The response contains the file infos in a map.

/eas/download/{fileId}/{hash}/{version}.description: The download endpoint is used to deliver binary file data. It delivers data for original files as well as renditions. These URL to the files should be taken from the responses of `/api/db` or `/api/search`.

parameters.description: The target format of the produced file. Defaults to the extension of the file parent.
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: set the target size
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: set the target width
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: set the target height
parameters.name: height

parameters.description:
* "max": "size" is the maximum side
* "min": "size" is the minimum side
* "width": "size" is the width * "height"
* "size" is the height.

If "width" and "height" are given, `resize_mode`` can either be "cover"
or "force". "cover" will cut of overflowing pixels, "contain" will
not cut off any pixels and "force" will not preserve the aspect
ratio. "max" is the default for "size" and "cover" for "width"
and "height".
parameters.name: resize_mode

parameters.description: Quality is used to set the JPEG quality. **maximum** is 100, **medium** is 75, **small** and **low** are 50.
parameters.name: quality

schema.description: The binary data of the file.

200.description: The response will use the proper mimetype for the file.
The response will use the proper mimetype for the file.

/eas/download/{fileId}/{hash}/{version}/.description:
The download endpoint is used to deliver binary file data. It delivers data for original files as well as renditions. These URL to the files should be taken from the responses of `/api/db` or `/api/search`.
If a `zippath` is given, the specified file or directory is returned. In case of an directory, descriptive JSON is returned for the directory.

is_dir.description: Indicates if the entry is a file or directory.

mod_time.description: The modification time of the file, omitted for directories.

name.description: The name of the file or directory.

path.description: The full `zippath` of the file or directory.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes, omitted for directories.

schema.description: The binary data of the file.

200.description: The response will use the proper mimetype for the file. In case of a directory, the response will be `JSON`.
The response will use the proper mimetype for the file.

/eas/produce.description: This endpoint is used to produce a new version of the file. It allows to crop and rotate images. The new file gets a new id. The `produce_version` setting from the parent is inherited.

eas_parent_id.description: The file "original" the new produced version should be created from.

format.description:
The target format of the produced file. Defaults to the
extension of the file parent.

transform.description:
The transformations applied. The order is `rotate-z`, `rotate-x`
or `rotate-y` and then `crop`.

crop.description:
Crop will cut out the pixels starting at +top +left with the
given width and height. If the cropped rectangle intersects
with the dimensions of the image, the intersection is used.
If it is outside the image, an image with 1x1 pixel is
produced.

rotate-x.description:
If a value other than `0` is given, the image is mirrored on
the x-axis (top <-> bottom). This is mutually exclusive with
`rotate-z`.

rotate-y.description:
If a value other than `0` is given, the image is mirrored on
the y-axis (left <-> right). This is mutually exclusive with
`rotate-x`.

rotate-z.description:
The image is rotated by the given number in degrees. Valid
degrees are -360 to 360. For degrees other than multiple of
90, the background is set to transparent unless the format
doesn't support it in which case the background is black.

200.description: The newly created file will be returned.

post.description: Endpoint to upload one or multiple files. `PUT` and `POST` are identical.

items.description: The [file](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file) rendered in `long` format.

200.description: Upload was successful.

put.description: Endpoint to upload one or multiple files. `PUT` and `POST` are identical.

200.description: Upload was successful.

/eas/rput.description: The **eas/rput** endpoint is used to asynchronously upload files. Use **/eas/put** to synchronously upload files. A file can only be inserted if a filename is provided, either by setting it as query parameter or in the `Content-Disposition` header set by the web server of the URL.

parameters.description: The filename to store. The extension of the filename determines the routing for this file. It is the basis for the the permission check as well as the version production. If the filename is omitted, **fylr** will use the filename retrieved by the `HEAD` request which is performend to check the `url`. If `skip_head_request` is used, `filename` is mandatory.
parameters.name: filename

parameters.description: If `leave` is set, the file will not be copied into the **fylr** storage. Use this to manage remote files which are not meant to be copied into fylr storage. Renditions for this file will still be produced by **fylr**.
parameters.name: leave

parameters.description: If a version name is given, the upload is meant to be a manual rendition. As such, the `id_parents` must be given alongside with it. The referenced parent files must be `original` and have set their `produce_versions` to false. Version names must be unique for all manually uploaded versions.
parameters.name: version_name

parameters.description: A parent id must be set for manual rendition uploads when using `version_names`. The id must point to a file "original".
parameters.name: id_parent

parameters.description: A unique file reference to identify the file. It can be used in file lookups when linking files to objects.
parameters.name: reference

parameters.description: Custom produce config is explained in `POST /api/v1/eas/{fileId}`.
parameters.name: custom_produce_config

parameters.description: If set to `true`, fylr produces renditions for each file uploaded, if set to `false`, no versions are produced. If no values is given (no parameter set or less values than needed), `true` is assumed.
parameters.name: produce_versions

parameters.description: If set to `false`, metadata for this file can be provived in the request body. This is only allowed if `leave` is set to `true` and `produce_versions` to `false`. This is used by **fylr restore** for the fastest mode to (test-)import files from another system.
parameters.name: generate_metadata

parameters.description:
The URL to copy the file from. **fylr** is trying to connect to the URL using a `HEAD` request. If a non `200` response is received from that request, a `GET` request is performed (without reading the body).
If no `filename` is given, the request is used to determine the filename. If a `filename` without an extension is given, the request is used to determine the extension.
If a filename in the `Content-Disposition` header is found, **fylr** used that. If not, the last part of the URL is used to derive a filename. If that name has no extension, **fylr** parses the `Content-Type` header to determine a file extension from the provided MIME type. The `Content-Type` header also sets the MIME type of the file in the database.
The `Content-Length` header is used to set the filesize of the file. If `leave` is set, the `Content-Length` header with a filesize > 0 is required. If `leave` is not set, the `Content-Length` header can be missing. If it is there, it needs to be > 0 too.
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: If a `delete_url` is given it is stored alongside with the remote URL. If the action `copy_move_produce` is used on that file, the URL will be requested after the file has been copied into the **fylr** storage.
parameters.name: delete_url

parameters.description: If set, **fylr** does not check the validity of the URL by performing the `HEAD` request to the remote server. If set, providing a `filename` is required. This can be used to speed up file imports.
parameters.name: skip_head_request

schema.description: The metadata object should contain a group `_technical_metadata` which includes the bare information about the file, such as `width` and `height`.

requestBody.description: The body may contain the metadata to be stored for this file. If sent, the query parameter `generate_metadata` must be set to `false`.

items.description: The [file](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file) rendered in `long` format.

200.description: The file was registered with **fylr**.

/eas/rput/bulk.description: The **eas/rput/bulk** endpoint is used to asynchronously upload files. It works like **eas/rput** but in bulk. This is the fastest method to upload files into **fylr**.

custom_produce_config.description: Custom produce config is explained in `POST /api/v1/eas/{fileId}`.

delete_url.description: If a `delete_url` is given it is stored alongside with the remote URL. If the action `copy_move_produce` is used on that file, the URL will be requested after the file has been copied into the **fylr** storage.

filename.description: The filename to store. The extension of the filename determines the routing for this file. It is the basis for the the permission check as well as the version production. If the filename is omitted, **fylr** will use the filename retrieved by the `HEAD` request which is performend to check the `url`. If `skip_head_request` is used, `filename` is mandatory.

generate_metadata.description: If set to `false`, metadata for this file can be provived in the property `metadata`. This is only allowed if `leave` is set to `true` and `produce_versions` to `false`. This is used by **fylr restore** for the fastest mode to (test-)import files from another system.

id_parent.description: A parent id must be set for manual rendition uploads when using `version_names`. The id must point to a file "original".

leave.description: If `leave` is set, the file will not be copied into the **fylr** storage. Use this to manage remote files which are not meant to be copied into fylr storage. Renditions for this file will still be produced by **fylr**.

metadata.description: The metadata object should contain a group `_technical_metadata` which includes the bare information about the file, such as `width` and `height`.

produce_versions.description: If set to `true`, fylr produces renditions for each file uploaded, if set to `false`, no versions are produced. If no values is given (no parameter set or less values than needed), `true` is assumed.

reference.description: A unique file reference to identify the file. It can be used in file lookups when linking files to objects.

skip_head_request.description: If set, **fylr** does not check the validity of the URL by performing the `HEAD` request to the remote server. If set, providing a `filename` is required. This can be used to speed up file imports.

url.description:
The URL to copy the file from. **fylr** is trying to connect to the URL using a `HEAD` request. If a non `200` response is received from that request, a `GET` request is performed (without reading the body).
If no `filename` is given, the request is used to determine the filename. If a `filename` without an extension is given, the request is used to determine the extension.
If a filename in the `Content-Disposition` header is found, **fylr** used that. If not, the last part of the URL is used to derive a filename. If that name has no extension, **fylr** parses the `Content-Type` header to determine a file extension from the provided MIME type. The `Content-Type` header also sets the MIME type of the file in the database.
The `Content-Length` header is used to set the filesize of the file. If `leave` is set, the `Content-Length` header with a filesize > 0 is required. If `leave` is not set, the `Content-Length` header can be missing. If it is there, it needs to be > 0 too.

version_name.description: If a version name is given, the upload is meant to be a manual rendition. As such, the `id_parents` must be given alongside with it. The referenced parent files must be `original` and have set their `produce_versions` to false. Version names must be unique for all manually uploaded versions.

requestBody.description: The body contains an array of file urls with information to be put into **fylr's** database. Files are copied asynchronously from the given urls into **fylr** storage, unless they are marked `leave` in which case the file will not be copied, and only linked into the storage.

items.description: The [file](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file) rendered in `long` format.

200.description: The file was registered with **fylr**.

/eas/zoom/{fileId}/{hash}/obj_uuid/{obj_.description: The endpoint zoom is used to deliver tiles for images. Use the `/api/db` and `/api/search` endpoints to retrieve the base URL to zoom and add the parameters to pick the tile accordingly. Tiles can be of any size and position. The `avoid_interpolation` part of the URL is there for compabitlity reasons with easydb 5 and currently unsupported in fylr. This endpoint uses the default tile size `320`.

200.description: The binary data of the tile.

/eas/zoom/{fileId}/{hash}/obj_uuid/{obj_.description: The endpoint zoom is used to deliver tiles for images. Use the `/api/db` and `/api/search` endpoints to retrieve the base URL to zoom and add the parameters to pick the tile accordingly. Tiles can be of any size and position. The `avoid_interpolation` part of the URL is there for compabitlity reasons with easydb 5 and currently unsupported in fylr.

200.description: The binary data of the tile.

/eas/{fileId}.description: The **eas** endpoint is used to upload and download files. Files are an essential part of a **fylr** system. Files and objects are separate entities. In order to use a file, it must be linked to an object by its `ID`. Files cannot be updated, in case of an update a new file `ID` is issued and linked to the updated object.

additionalProperties.description: The [file](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file) rendering. The `key` is the file ID.

200.description: The response contains the file info.

get.summary: Get information about a file. The user needs the right `RIGHT_ASSET_SHOW`.

parameters.description: If set, the call is only checking if the current user is allowed to update the file information.
parameters.name: permission_check_only

filename.description: The new filename of the file. It is stored as `original_filepath`.

reference.description: The reference string for the file. Note that the reference is unique across all files in the storage.

oneOf.description: Returned if `permission_check_only` was set and the permission check was successful.

200.description: Update was successful.

post.summary: Change information about a file. You need the `RIGHT_ASSET_UPLOAD` right to update the file information.

get.description:
This settings endpoint is unprotected and delivers brief information about
the running fylr instance. It can also be used to check the current status
of the running fylr.

build_commit.description: The GIT commit hash set at compile time.

build_commit_time.description: The UTC timestamp of the GIT commit hash the fylr was built with.

config_name.description: The internal name of the instace, as set in the base configuration.

external_url.description: The url this fylr is reachable under. This is configured in the fylr yaml.

index_names.description:
Index names as used in the Elatic indexing system. There is
two indexes for reading (BaseRead & ObjectRead) and two for
writing. New writing indexes are created when a reindex is
started. Once that reindex has finished, the read index is
deleted and the read index name becomes the write index name.
If these names are identical, the index is up to date.

instance.description: The name of the instance as set in the yaml config file.

name.description:
A UID generated when the database is created. The name gets
re-created when **/api/purge** is used. This name is used as
prefix for Elastic index names.

num_cpu.description: The number of CPU available for the Go runtime as reported by [runtime.NumCPU](https://pkg.go.dev/runtime#NumCPU).

startup_time.description: UTC time of when the server was started.

version.description:
The version of the server. Changed with every release, follows
semantic versioning rules.

version_release_date.description: If known, the release date of this **version**. <unreleased> if not yet released.

200.description: Brief information about the running fylr.

x-fylr-status.description:
Current status of the fylr system:
  * `startup`: Set during startup of fylr. Should rarely be seen.
  * `reindex`: System is re-indexing. This happens after a `reindex_block` is used during a schema commit.
    This state is also reached briefly after a regular `reindex`.
  * `busy`: If too many db connections are open, the system response with `busy`.
  * `ready`: In this state fylr is ready to answer requests.

bytes.description: BASE64 encoded binary data for the attachement.

content-type.description: The `Content-Type` header of the attachment multipart.

filename.description: Filename used for this attachment, set in the `Content-Disposition` header of the attachment multipart.

cc.description: The _Cc_ addresses to use in the mail header.

from.description: The _From_ address to use in the mail header.

html.description: The body of the mail in HTML format. You can reference attachements using the `cid:` semantic. Use the `cid:<URL>` as source for images. If the `cid:` is followed by an URL, the data is requested and attached. The `cid:<URL>` is then replaced with a filename referencing the attachment. If the URL begins with `fylr.externalURL`, the current access token is appended to the URL. With this, local file previews can be accessed and embedded in the email.

subject.description: The _Subject_ to use in the mail header.

text.description: The body of the mail in TEXT format.

to.description: The _To_ address to use in the mail header.

200.description: The mail has been handed over successfully to the MTA (mail transfer agent)

400.description: An error occurred, this triggers a `EMAIL_SENT_ERROR` event to be written.

post.summary: This endpoint sends an mail using the fylr server infrastructure. The mail is composed as multipart mail with separate HTML and text bodies. The user needs the `system.sendmail` or `system.root` system right. After sending an email `EMAIL_SENT` or `EMAIL_SENT_ERROR` event is written.

to.description: The _To_ address to use in the mail header.

200.description: The mail has been handed over successfully to the MTA (mail transfer agent)

400.description: An error occurred, this triggers a `EMAIL_SENT_ERROR` event to be written.

post.summary: This endpoint sends a test email to one mail address. The user needs the `system.sendmail` or `system.root` system right. After sending an email `EMAIL_SENT` or `EMAIL_SENT_ERROR` event is written.

get.description: This endpoint returns all available taggroups and tags.

200.description: Success
Success

/task.description:
Use this endpoint to store & retrieve tasks. A task is a configuration to
run a task module with pre-configured parameters. The tasks are executed in
the background. Tasks can be scheduled to run periodically.

Tasks are user specific. Like exports, tasks are run under as the user who created the task. When listing tasks, only the creating user can see his tasks.

Users need the system right `system.task` to perform task operations.

parameters.description: Request the given `offset` of the log.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Request using the given `limit`. Default is 100.
parameters.name: limit

count.description: The total count of the tasks of the session user.

200.description: Retrieve a list of tasks
Created a new task.
Created a new task.
Retrieve a list of available task modules.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: taskId

200.description: The task was successfully deleted.

/task/{taskId}.description: Access a single task by ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: taskId

200.description: The task.

patch.description: Update a task. Task can only be updated if they are not in state `running`.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: taskId

200.description: The patched task.

/task/{taskId}/cancel.description: Tasks in status `running` can be canceled.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: taskId

200.description: The task was updated to be canceled. The task runner will cancel the task as soon as possible. The task will be in `status` _canceled_.

/task/{taskId}/log.description: Access the log of a specific task.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: taskId

parameters.description: Request the given `offset` of the log.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Request using the given `limit`. Default is 100.
parameters.name: limit

idx.description: Index of the log entry, starts at `0`.

status_percent.description: The current status in percent, can be `null`. If set (per task module), the task runner updates the `status_percent` of the task to the latest data.

200.description: Task runners can write log entries. This endpoint can be used to retrieve them.

/zoom/{fileId}/{hash}/obj_uuid/{obj_uuid.description: The endpoint zoom is used to deliver tiles for images. Use the `/api/db` and `/api/search` endpoints to retrieve the base URL to zoom and add the parameters to pick the tile accordingly. Tiles can be of any size and position. The `avoid_interpolation` part of the URL is there for compabitlity reasons with easydb 5 and currently unsupported in fylr. This endpoint uses the default tile size `320`.

200.description: The binary data of the tile.
